com.Grateds.game.AI.lib

Interface AdversarySearchProblem<S extends AdversarySearchState>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdversaryProblem

    public interface AdversarySearchProblem<S extends AdversarySearchState>
    Interface which defines the basic elements necessary for characterising a problem as a search. Instances of these problems should implement this interface, to be able to use the adversary search strategies.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Grateds

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean end(S state)
      Indicates whether a given state is an end state, i.e., a state with no successors.
      java.util.List<S> getSuccessors(S state)
      Returns the list of successor states for a given state, in the context of the current problem.
      S initialState()
      Returns the initial state corresponding to the problem.
      int maxValue()
      Indicates the greatest possible value for a state in the problem.
      int minValue()
      Indicates the least possible value for a state in the problem.
      int value(S state)
      Computes the value of a given state.

    • Method Detail

      • initialState

        S initialState()
        Returns the initial state corresponding to the problem. Concrete implementations of AdversarySearchProblem must implement this routine, to indicate the starting point for the (adversary) search.
        Returns:
        the initial state for the problem.

      • getSuccessors

        java.util.List<S> getSuccessors(S state)
        Returns the list of successor states for a given state, in the context of the current problem. Concrete implementations of AdversarySearchProblem must implement this routine, to indicate the 'advance' rules (or game rules) for the search.
        Parameters:
        state - is the state for which its successors are being computed.
        Returns:
        the list of successor states of state.

      • end

        boolean end(S state)
        Indicates whether a given state is an end state, i.e., a state with no successors.
        Parameters:
        state - is the state being checked to be an end state.
        Returns:
        true iff state is an end state.

      • value

        int value(S state)
        Computes the value of a given state. If the state is a leaf (end state), then this value is an exact value, and indicates the outcome of the game. If the state is not an end state, then this value is an approximate value. Its estimation plays a crucial role in the performance of search.
        Parameters:
        state - is the state for which its value is being computed.
        Returns:
        an integer value, representing the value of the state. This value must be greater than minValue(), and smaller than maxValue().

      • minValue

        int minValue()
        Indicates the least possible value for a state in the problem. Together with maxValue(), it determines an interval in which values for states must range.
        Returns:
        an integer value, representing the least possible value for the problem. This value must be strictly smaller than maxValue().

      • maxValue

        int maxValue()
        Indicates the greatest possible value for a state in the problem. Together with minValue(), it determines an interval in which values for states must range.
        Returns:
        an integer value, representing the greatest possible value for the problem. This value must be strictly greater than minValue().
